Articles.Content: Like it or not, KSP 2 is in the state it is in . @ShadowZone just released a video offering tips to make the KSP 2 experience more enjoyable in the immediate and I think it would benefit those playing to look over this summary of player side fixes available for some issues

This just occurred to me while watching this since there isn't, afaik, a built-in environment variable for LocalLow in AppData, but you can get to it by typing %APPDATA%\..\LocalLow in the File Explorer address bar. This will take it to AppData\Roaming, then go up one level, then go down to LocalLow. Just might be easier since users might not have Show Hidden Files enabled by default.

17 minutes ago, whatsEJstandfor said:

This just occurred to me while watching this since there isn't, afaik, a built-in environment variable for LocalLow in AppData

I was about to mention %LOCALAPPDATA% but it turns out that goes to Local, not LocalLow. Weird, I wonder why.

Just now, Missingno200 said:

I was about to mention %LOCALAPPDATA% but it turns out that goes to Local, not LocalLow. Weird, I wonder why.

Yeah, I never really understood why %appdata% goes to Roaming when it always seemed like it should just go to, uh, AppData (probably a legacy thing that still exists for compatibility reasons) or why there's a %localappdata% variable but no %locallowappdata% variable

Just now, whatsEJstandfor said:

Yeah, I never really understood why %appdata% goes to Roaming when it always seemed like it should just go to, uh, AppData (probably a legacy thing that still exists for compatibility reasons) or why there's a %localappdata% variable but no %locallowappdata% variable

Definitely legacy, Windows spent 36 years trying to be backwards compatible with its very first version. It's why there's so many DOS-isms, and why DOS-era batch scripts still work to this day. Enterprises love that stuff, and so do I.
But still, it's strange, no %lowappdata% or anything.

16 hours ago, whatsEJstandfor said:

This just occurred to me while watching this since there isn't, afaik, a built-in environment variable for LocalLow in AppData, but you can get to it by typing %APPDATA%\..\LocalLow in the File Explorer address bar. This will take it to AppData\Roaming, then go up one level, then go down to LocalLow. Just might be easier since users might not have Show Hidden Files enabled by default.

Yes, this works.

I contemplated whether or not I should be throwing environmental variables at people who may never heard of the concept, so I stuck to the full path, because I figured people will at least have heard that they have a drive in their PC.
